title: How to Draw Emo Panda

steps.headline: Start by lightly drawing a large, slightly flat oval.
steps.description: Then draw two little circles spread far apart on the top. Use a compass for the circles for greater accuracy.

steps.headline: Draw the body.
steps.description: Make a large, U-shaped half circle directly under the head.

steps.headline: Add short, stocky legs.
steps.description: Draw two rectangles coming off the body shape. Next, curve the edges so that to make the legs appear more circular rather than straight.

steps.headline: Draw the arms.
steps.description: Draw a straight line across the body horizontally just a little below the head. Then, on either side of the panda, draw two long ovals extending from the bottom of the head to just above the beginning of the legs.

steps.headline: Color in the arms, legs, and ears using a black marker.
steps.description: Also color in the section between the base of the panda's face and the horizontal line.

steps.headline: Focus on the face.
steps.description: Draw a small, upside-down U-shape near the bottom of the head to create the mouth. Draw a small dot for the nose.

steps.headline: Create the emo panda's eyes.
steps.description: The panda's eyes should be large, as this is what gives the drawing both its cute effect and the emo appearance. Draw two big circles with a smaller one in between. Make the smaller circle a bright color or simply leave it white. For the pupils, draw two more smaller circles near the center. Leave the inside of this circle white.

steps.headline: Color the rest of the eye black.
steps.description: When finished, the eye should have a small white dot in the middle, a bright ring around it, and it will be black everywhere else. Play with the placement of the pupil until you get the exact expression you want.

text: Start by lightly drawing a large, slightly flat oval. Then draw two little circles spread far apart on the top. Use a compass for the circles for greater accuracy. Draw the body. Make a large, U-shaped half circle directly under the head. Add short, stocky legs. Draw two rectangles coming off the body shape. Next, curve the edges so that to make the legs appear more circular rather than straight. Draw the arms. Draw a straight line across the body horizontally just a little below the head. Then, on either side of the panda, draw two long ovals extending from the bottom of the head to just above the beginning of the legs. Color in the arms, legs, and ears using a black marker. Also color in the section between the base of the panda's face and the horizontal line. Focus on the face. Draw a small, upside-down U-shape near the bottom of the head to create the mouth. Draw a small dot for the nose. Create the emo panda's eyes. The panda's eyes should be large, as this is what gives the drawing both its cute effect and the emo appearance. Draw two big circles with a smaller one in between. Make the smaller circle a bright color or simply leave it white. For the pupils, draw two more smaller circles near the center. Leave the inside of this circle white. Color the rest of the eye black. When finished, the eye should have a small white dot in the middle, a bright ring around it, and it will be black everywhere else. Play with the placement of the pupil until you get the exact expression you want.
